trans-unit.source: Encapsulates basic validation rules that indicate whether a piece of custom data is considered personalizable in either <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared"></xref> scope.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> instance is a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> objects, which consist of a personalization scope and an object value.
These entries are assigned a key in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> object.
A good practice is to add all properties to the dictionary using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IPersonalizable.Save%2A> method, regardless of the scope of the page.
The .NET Framework saves the information in the appropriate way; for example, shared data is saved when the page is in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope.

However, shared properties are not saved when a Web Parts value is being saved, the page is in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control was added with the page in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes an empty dictionary.
The dictionary will treat key values as case-insensitive.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class using the provided parameter.
This constructor initializes an empty dictionary based on the estimated number of entries to be stored in the dictionary.
The dictionary will treat key values as case-insensitive.
The estimated number of entries to be stored in the dictionary.
Adds personalization entries to the personalization dictionary.
You can call this method, place various pieces of custom state information into the state object, and specify the scope associated with the state value.

When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control is in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope, you can add name and state information that is associated with either <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope.

In <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope, you can add name and state information associated only with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope.

It is a good practice, however, to add all properties to the dictionary using <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IPersonalizable.Save%2A> including properties with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope, regardless of the scope of the page.
The .NET Framework only saves the properties with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope when appropriate.

In other words, shared properties are not saved when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control that was initially added in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope is later saved while the page is in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope.

In an opposite scenario, if a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control was added to the page in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> scope, and the control is later saved while the page is in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope, custom shared property values are saved (along with custom user-scoped properties).

For details on personalization data and how shared and user-scoped properties are affected by the personalization scope of the page, see the [Web Parts Personalization Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7dc34f74-52aa-4082-b98d-2bcf9e07e320) topic.
As with any collection, this method increments the collection count by one and any enumerators currently active on the collection should be invalidated.
The unique identifier for a piece of state information.
A piece of state information to be added to the personalization dictionary.
This value can be `null`.
key is a duplicate of a key already in the dictionary.
\- or -
key is either an empty string ("") or trimming key results in an empty string.
\- or -
value is not a .
key is `null`.
\- or -
value is `null`.
Removes all custom state information from the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> object.
This method clears all custom state information from the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> object.
Any enumerators currently active against the collection should be invalidated.
To remove only a specific personalization entry in a personalization dictionary, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Remove%2A> method.
Note that calling this method on an empty personalization dictionary does not raise an error.
Returns a value indicating whether a piece of custom state information with the same key is contained in the personalization dictionary.
Use this method to determine whether a piece of custom state information is contained in a personalization dictionary.
A key value.
`true` if the provided key matches a key in the personalization dictionary; otherwise, `false`.
key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.
key is `null`.
Copies the personalization dictionary state entries as <xref href="System.Collections.DictionaryEntry"></xref> instances into the specified array.
Use this method to create an array of <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> instances from the state entries in the personalization dictionary.
The array the <xref href="System.Collections.DictionaryEntry"></xref> instances are copied into.
The index location at which to begin copying.
array is multidimensional.
\- or -
array is the wrong size based on the index parameter.
\- or -
array has insufficient capacity to hold the values contained in the personalization dictionary.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
Gets the number of entries in the dictionary.
Use this property to get the number of entries in the personalization dictionary.
The number of entries in the dictionary.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the entries in the personalization dictionary.
Enumerators can be used to read the data in a collection, but cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
For more information on enumerators, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator"></xref> for the personalization dictionary.
Gets whether the personalization dictionary is of a fixed size.
This property always returns `false` because personalization dictionaries are not of a fixed size.
`false` in all cases.
Gets whether the personalization dictionary is read-only.
This property always returns `false` because personalization dictionaries are not read-only.
`false` in all cases.
Gets whether the personalization dictionary is synchronized.
This property always returns `false` because personalization dictionaries are not synchronized.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets an entry in the personalization dictionary.
This property works with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> object representing custom personalization information that is identified by the `key` parameter.
If there is no value for `key`, `null` is returned.
If `key` does not already exist, then `key` (and its associated value) are added to the dictionary.
Note that you can add a null value to the dictionary, and the indexer can also be used to update the personalization value.
The key of the entry to be retrieved or changed.
A representing custom personalization information identified by the key parameter.
key is `null`.
key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.
Gets a reference to an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> object containing the keys for the personalization dictionary.
Use this method to obtain the keys for a personalization dictionary.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> containing the keys for the personalization dictionary.
Removes a custom state entry based on the provided key.
Internally, when you remove a custom state entry, the count of the personalization dictionary is decremented by one.
Any enumerators currently active against the dictionary should be invalidated.
No error occurs if you attempt to remove a nonexistent key.
The key of the entry to be removed.
key is `null`.
key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the personalization dictionary.
For collections whose underlying store is not publicly available, the expected implementation is to return the current instance.

Note that the pointer to the current instance might not be sufficient for collections that wrap other collections; those should return the underlying collection's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.SyncRoot%2A> property.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the personalization dictionary.
Gets a reference to an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> object containing the values in the personalization dictionary.
Use this method to obtain the values from a personalization dictionary.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> containing the values for the personalization dictionary.

Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref> method for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.CopyTo%2A> method checks to determine whether `array` is an array of <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> items, then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.CopyTo%2A> method, passing to it `array` and `index`.
An <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of <xref href="System.Collections.DictionaryEntry"></xref> items to copy into a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref>.
The starting point in a at which to insert array.
array is not an array of items.

Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary.Add(System.Object,System.Object)"></xref> method for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Add%2A> method checks several details to ensure the validity of `value` and `key` before attempting to add them to the personalization dictionary.

If the checks are successful, the method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Add%2A> method, passing to it the `key` and `value` parameters.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to use as the key for an item in the personalization dictionary.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> to add to the personalization dictionary.
value is `null`.
key is not a object.
\- or -
value is not a object.
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary.Contains(System.Object)"></xref> method for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Contains%2A> method checks `key` to ensure it is a valid object for checking the personalization dictionary, and if so, it passes it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Contains%2A> method.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> object that identifies a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> to check for existence in the personalization dictionary.
`true` if key exists in the personalization dictionary; otherwise `false`.
key is not a .

Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary.Item(System.Object)"></xref> property value for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Item%2A> first ensures that `key` is a <xref:System.String> object, and if so, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Item%2A> property to return the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> whose key equals `key` in the current dictionary.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that identifies a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> object in the personalization dictionary.
A object whose value matches key.
key is not a object.
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary.Remove(System.Object)"></xref> method for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Remove%2A> method checks whether `key` is a <xref:System.String> object, and if so, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.Remove%2A> method, passing `key` to it.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that identifies a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry"></xref> object to remove from the personalization dictionary.
key is not a .
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref> method for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.GetEnumerator%2A> method directly calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> class's own <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary.GetEnumerator%2A> method.
An instance of <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> to enumerate through the items in a personalization dictionary.
